# isAnimated

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether the transition is explicitly animated.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isAnimated: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for custom transitions — transitions where the view controller’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/modalPresentationStyle] property is set to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIModalPresentationStyle/custom] — even when the transition is started by a call to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewControllerAnimatedTransitioning/animateTransition(using:)] method. In nearly all other cases, the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

## Getting the transition state

- **initiallyInteractive**: A Boolean value indicating whether the transition started as an interactive transition.
- **isInteractive**: A Boolean value indicating whether the transition is currently interactive.
- **isCancelled**: A Boolean value indicating whether an interactive transition was canceled.
- **isInterruptible**: A Boolean value indicating whether the transition animations can be interrupted.
